SAGE desktop application for managing tasks that allows one to keep
track of one's tasks, deadlines, and events. It is designed to be
used via a Command Line Interface (CLI) while benefiting from a
1. Ensure you have Java 11 or above installed in your Computer.
1. Download the iP.jar file from github.com/Yanneko/ip/releases
1. Move the file to the target *home folder* for SAGE.
1. Double-click the file to start the app. The GUI similar to what
is shown below should appear in a few seconds.
1. Refer to the Features below for details of each command.
Alternatively, takes in one command word as an argument and
displays the details for that specific command.
Lists all tasks in the task list.
Adds a ToDo task to the task list.
* `<task name>` can be a String of any length except 0, i.e. it cannot
Adds a deadline task to the task list.
* `<deadline title>` can be a String of any length except 0, i.e. it cannot
* Date format has to be maintained.
* Time entry `<hhmm>` for the deadline task is optional. If absent,
Adds an event task to the task list.
* `<event title>` can be a String of any length except 0, i.e. it cannot
* Date format has to be maintained.
* Time entry `<hhmm>` for the deadline task is optional. If absent,
Marks a task as done using its index in the task list.
* `<index>` is the task index number as seen when `list` is called.
### Delete a task from the task list : `list`
Deletes a task from the task list using its index in the task list.
* `<index>` is the task index number as seen when `list` is called.
### Find tasks based on a keyword : `find`
Finds all tasks that have the specified keyword in it.

* Representation of a Deadline task. Inherits from Task.
* Class constructor. Creates a not done Deadline object with name set to the specified taskName
* and deadline set to the specified deadLine. Converts and stores the deadline as LocalDate and LocalTime.
* @param taskName The specified name of the new Deadline object.
* @param deadLine The specified deadline of the new Deadline object.
* A method to create a neatly formatted String that describes this Deadline.
* @return Neatly formatted String representation of this Deadline.
* Generates a formatted String for storage read and write purposes.
* @return Formatted data String to be used by Storage.

* Controller for MainWindow. Provides the layout for the other controls.

* Duke's Parser. Deals with making sense of the user command.
* Takes in the user's command and decides the appropriate action to take, then returns the output string for
* the UI object to display. Uses references to taskList, storage, scanner and ui in order to edit the task list,
* store the task list when done, scan for arguments to commands and end the ui when needed.
* @param input The user input for the parser to parse.
* @return Output String for the associated UI object to display.
return "Notice. Unfamiliar command detected. Enter 'help' to view commands.\n";
outputString.append("Understood. The following task has been completed:\n");
outputString.append("Notice. The following task has been removed:\n");
outputString.append("Understood. The following tasks were found: \n");
outputString.append("IOException thrown, task list not saved.\n");
.append("list | todo | deadline | event | done | delete | find | bye\n")
outputString.append("bye: tells Sage to go away\n")
outputString.append("Notice. Unfamiliar command detected. Enter 'help' to view commands.\n");
* Duke's Storage. Deals with loading tasks from the file and saving tasks in the file.

* creates the data file. If the directory does not exist, creates the directory, then creates the file inside.
* @param filePath File path to open or create that will store the data file for the task list.
* Reads tasks from this storage object's data file and populates
* the specified TaskList with the read data, if any.
* @param taskList The specified TaskList object to be written to.

* Abstract class that represents a Task entry. Contains the name of the task taskName
* and a boolean done to show whether it is done or not. Has methods to deal with marking tasks as done or not
* and methods to generate data strings for storage.
* Class constructor which creates a Task object with the name set to the specified taskName.
* Created Task is set to not done by default.

* Duke's TaskList. Contains the task list and has operations to modify the list.
* Class constructor. Creates the TaskList and an empty ArrayList of Tasks to store future tasks.
* Adds the specified next Task to the taskList.
* Gets the Task from the taskList at the index specified.
* @param index The specified index of the wanted Task.
* @return The Task in the taskList at the specified index.
* Removes and returns the Task from the taskList at the specified index.
* @param index The specified index of the Task to be removed.
* @return The Task that was removed from the taskList at the specified index.
* Returns the current size of the taskList.
* @return Size of the taskList as an integer.
